CatDescriptText: Mr. H. Ulanoff, retired worker, Pittsburgh, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower should invoke the Taft-Hartley Act in steel strike?" answer reads: "Yes, sir, because there is no other way to avoid use of the law. The 80 days' cooling-off period, which Taft-Hartley calls for, may bring a settlement."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of H. Ulanoff wearing dark fedora, herringbone jacket, diagonally striped tie, and flecked overcoat, standing on sidewalk in front of stores, Downtown
